title: ‘The King’s Peace’ Review: An Iron Fist in a Legal Glove
sub_head: Long-maintained checks on state power were often set aside in the face of colonial unrest.
body:
The sword of Damocles, that proverbial knife edge overhanging the mighty by the slightest thread, is the ultimate symbol of power’s fragility. For its transfer, there is D.H. Lawrence’s imagined dialogue between one Septimus and King Arthur.

Septimus: We’re all equal in the sight of God, you know, Arthur.
Arthur: Yes.
Septimus: Then I guess it’s about time I had that yard-and-a-half of Excalibur to play with. Don’t you think so? We’re equal in the sight of God, and you’ve had it for quite a while.
